lia.Monitor.Store
Class AbstractPersistentStore

java.lang.Object
  lia.Monitor.Store.AbstractPersistentStore
Direct Known Subclasses:
MysqlStore, PersistentStoreFast
public abstract class AbstractPersistentStore
extends java.lang.Object

The methods provided with this abstract class MUST be implemented in any of the subclasses. This class provides a standard interface for all the storing methods (Sql, XML, JDO, File System, etc)

See Also:
lia.Monitor.Store.Sql.idbStore, monPredicate, Result

Method Detail

makePersistent

public abstract void makePersistent(Result[] values)
                             throws StoreException
Makes an array of Results persistent. If for some reasons the values cannot be stored a StoreException MUST be thrown.

Parameters:
values - The Results that must be stored.
Throws:
StoreException
See Also:
Result

deleteOld

public abstract void deleteOld(long time,
                               int indent,
                               long avgTime)
                        throws StoreException
Deletes the data older than time. If for some reasons the values cannot be deleted than a StoreException MUST be thrown.

Parameters:
time - Time in milliseconds. It's an absolute time (milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT)
Throws:
StoreException

getResults

public abstract java.util.Vector getResults(monPredicate p)
                                     throws StoreException
Retrives the values that match a monPredicate. If for some reasons the values cannot be retrived than a StoreException MUST be thrown.

Returns:
A java.util.Vector of Results.
Throws:
StoreException
See Also:
lia.Monitor.monitor.monPredicate, to see how a monPredicate must be interpreted., StoreException

                                     throws StoreException

updateConfig

public abstract void updateConfig(MFarm mfarm)
                           throws StoreException
This method MUST store the Farm configuration (Farm Name, Cluster Names, Nodes, Module Names). It is subject to change in the following versions! If for some reasons the configuration cannot be stored a StoreException MUST be thrown.

Throws:
StoreException
See Also:
MFarm
